metadata.titleEn: Mapping of lakes larger than 0.01 km2 in the Tibet Plateau (2016-2021)
metadata.description: The Tibet Plateau (TP) is the highest and youngest plateau in the world and one of the most sensitive areas to global climate change. The lake areas in the TP account for more than half of China’s total lake area, so it is of great significance to obtain the lake distribution in the TP for the study of climate and environmental change in the Tibetan Plateau. Most previous studies focused on obtaining the data of lakes larger than 1km2, but the number of small lakes distributed on the TP is much larger than that of larger lakes, and small lakes are more active in global ecosystems than large lakes and terrestrial and marine ecosystems. In order to obtain lakes larger than 0.01km2 on the entire TP, all TP lakes from 2016 to 2021 were extracted using D-LinkNet based on Sentinel-1 SAR data. The lake dataset shows an area accuracy of 86.49% in different regions. The lake dataset can be mainly used for the study of lake variation, lake water balance and climate change in the Tibet Plateau. The data type of the lakes dataset is vector data, the attribute field includes Area (km2), and the projection is WGS84.
metadata.instructions: (1) Data file naming: "TP_Lake_YYYY.shp", in which < TP > represent Spatial range for the Tibet Plateau, < Lake > represent the lakes larger than 0.01km2, < YYYY > on behalf of the year, such as "TP_Lake_2016.shp". (2) Data usage: The data can be edited and visualized using ArcGIS.

authorList.unitEn: Institute of Agricultural Resources and Regional Planning, Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences
Institute of Agricultural Resources and Regional Planning, Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: Mapping of lakes in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau from 2016 to 2021: trend and potential regularity
literatureList.referenceEn: Yang, Z.C., Duan, S.B., Dai, X.A., Sun, Y.W., & Liu, M. (2022). Mapping of lakes in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau from 2016 to 2021: trend and potential regularity. International Journal of Digital Earth, 15(1), 1692-1714, DOI: 10.1080/17538947.2022.2131008

background: The Qinghai-Tibet Plateau (TP) is the highest and youngest plateau in the world and one of the most sensitive areas to global climate change. The lake areas in the TP account for more than half of China’s total lake area. Previous studies have indicated that most lakes in the TP have expanded over the past few decades, although lakes in the southern TP have been shrinking. Precipitation is the dominant factor driving lake changes in the TP (approximately 70%), and the trend of lake expansion may be driven by the wetting of the TP. Moreover, variations in lakes on the TP may have been driven by changes in large-scale atmospheric circulation, and lakes may have a response mechanism to strong climate change. For example, there were inflection points in 1997 and 2015, when lake changes were affected by the El Niño phenomenon, after which the lake continued to expand. Numerous lakes distributed on the TP provide feedback on global climate change, which may further influence the regional environment and climate. Small lakes play an important role in the global ecosystem. Emerging research has shown that small lakes are more active than large lakes and terrestrial and marine ecosystems in almost every process. The number of small lakes distributed on the TP is much larger than the number of larger lakes. In particular, glacial lakes developed in the Himalayas may have higher climate sensitivity and risk levels.
research objective: This study aims to map lakes on the entire TP with high accuracy and to analyze variations in lake area based on the Sentinel-1 dataset.
challenges: However, owing to the limitations of technology and methods, changes in smaller lakes on the TP have received less attention.
methods: In this study, we used Google Earth Engine (GEE) with the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) preparation framework to obtain preprocessed Sentinel-1 data covering the plateau. The D-LinkNet framework was introduced to achieve lake extraction, and the lake dataset was completed from 2016 to 2021.
dataset: The lake dataset was completed from 2016 to 2021. The lake dataset showed an area accuracy of 86.49% and Intersection over Union (IoU) of 0.72-0.99 in different regions.
findings: The findings were as follows: during the study period, the TP lakes tended to be stable after increasing, with an increase in area and number of +7.6% and +14.8%. Except for the northwest TP, the other regions show the same general trend. In particular, the Tarim Basin exhibited a lake variation pattern independent of the TP. Significantly, we found frequent lake activity in the Kunlun Mountains, Qaidam Basin, Mountain Qogir, etc. Effects of the ongoing La Niña event on the TP lakes may occur in the next few years.

Verification.Question: Are changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau receiving less attention due to technological limitations?
Is the D-LinkNet framework utilized for extracting lake data from Sentinel-1 imagery?

Disjunctive.Question: Which satellite data is more effective for mapping lake distributions on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, Sentinel-1, Landsat, or other satellite data?
Are lake extraction methods on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau predominantly based on deep learning frameworks like D-LinkNet, random forest algorithms, or traditional thresholding techniques?
What is the primary technological platform for processing and analyzing satellite data for the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, Google Earth Engine, ArcGIS, or another platform?

Concept Completion.Question: What challenges are associated with detecting changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
What is the area accuracy of the lake dataset that maps the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau from 2016 to 2021?

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method that ensures high accuracy in mapping lakes on the Tibetan Plateau?
Example.Answer: One data collection method involves using Google Earth Engine (GEE) with the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) preparation framework to obtain preprocessed Sentinel-1 data. This approach, combined with the D-LinkNet framework for lake extraction, achieved an area accuracy of 86.49%.

Example.Question: Could you illustrate an example of a technological challenge faced when studying smaller lakes on the Tibetan Plateau?
Example.Answer: A technological challenge is the limitation of existing technology and methods, which has historically led to less attention on changes in smaller lakes on the Tibetan Plateau.

Example.Question: What is an example of a dataset that captures the changes in lake areas on the Tibetan Plateau over a specific period?
Example.Answer: An example of such a dataset includes the lake distribution data from 2016 to 2021, which shows an area accuracy of 86.49% and Intersection over Union (IoU) of 0.72-0.99 in different regions.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the primary characteristics of data collection methodologies used for mapping lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Feature Specification.Answer: Sentinel-1 SAR data, D-LinkNet framework, Google Earth Engine, Analysis Ready Data preparation framework

Feature Specification.Question: What specific features determine the accuracy and reliability of lake datasets in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau region?
Feature Specification.Answer: area accuracy 86.49%, Intersection over Union (IoU) metrics 0.72 to 0.99

Feature Specification.Question: What challenges are associated with collecting data on smaller lakes in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, and how might these be addressed?
Feature Specification.Answer: technological limitations, methodological limitations, less attention to changes in smaller lakes

Quantification.Question: What is the range of Intersection over Union (IoU) values achieved across different regions in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau lake dataset?

Definition.Question: What is the D-LinkNet framework in the context of lake extraction on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Definition.Answer: The D-LinkNet framework is a method introduced to achieve lake extraction from Sentinel-1 data, allowing for the mapping of lakes with high accuracy on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.

Definition.Question: What is meant by 'area accuracy' in relation to a lake dataset?
Definition.Answer: In relation to a lake dataset, 'area accuracy' refers to the precision with which the dataset estimates the actual area of lakes, which is reported to be 86.49% in different regions for the dataset covering the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau from 2016 to 2021.

Definition.Question: What is 'Intersection over Union (IoU)' in the context of evaluating datasets?
Definition.Answer: Intersection over Union (IoU) is a measure used to evaluate the accuracy of a dataset by comparing the overlap between the predicted and true areas of lakes, with reported values ranging from 0.72 to 0.99 in different regions for the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau lake dataset.

Comparison.Question: How does the use of Sentinel-1 SAR data for extracting lake distribution on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau compare to other satellite data sources in terms of accuracy and coverage?
Comparison.Answer: The use of Sentinel-1 SAR data for extracting lake distribution on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau achieved an area accuracy of 86.49%, with a focus on lakes larger than 0.01 km2. This dataset provides a comprehensive temporal coverage from 2016 to 2021, making it suitable for analyzing changes in lake areas over time.

Comparison.Question: What are the similarities and differences in the challenges faced when mapping small versus large lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Comparison.Answer: Both small and large lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau are influenced by climate change, but small lakes have received less attention due to technological and methodological limitations. Small lakes are more numerous and active in the ecosystem, whereas larger lakes have been the primary focus of past research.

Comparison.Question: How do the methods used for lake extraction on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau compare with traditional field survey methods in terms of efficiency and scale?
Comparison.Answer: The lake extraction on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau using the D-LinkNet framework and Sentinel-1 data is efficient and suitable for large-scale mapping, achieving high accuracy and coverage. In contrast, traditional field survey methods may provide detailed local measurements but lack the efficiency and scalability for extensive regions like the plateau.

Interpretation.Question: How might the observed changes in lake distribution on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau reflect broader atmospheric and climatic trends?
Interpretation.Answer: The changes in lake distribution, such as the expansion trend driven by precipitation and inflection points affected by the El Niño phenomenon, suggest that these lakes may respond to large-scale atmospheric circulation and strong climate changes, reflecting broader climatic trends.

Interpretation.Question: What challenges do data collection methods face in accurately mapping small lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, and how might these challenges be addressed?
Interpretation.Answer: Challenges include technological limitations in detecting smaller lakes, which have received less attention. These challenges could potentially be addressed by employing advanced data processing frameworks like the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) preparation framework and leveraging platforms like Google Earth Engine (GEE) for preprocessing.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What causes the limited attention towards changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: Owing to the limitations of technology and methods, changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau have received less attention.

Causal Antecedent.Question: Why is it crucial to map lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau with high accuracy?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: It is crucial to map lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau with high accuracy because the variations in these lakes may provide feedback on global climate change, which can further influence the regional environment and climate.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What are the reasons behind using the D-LinkNet framework for lake extraction in data collection methods?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The D-LinkNet framework was introduced for lake extraction to achieve high accuracy in mapping lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau using Sentinel-1 data.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential consequences on data accuracy when using the D-LinkNet framework for lake extraction from Sentinel-1 data?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using the D-LinkNet framework for lake extraction from Sentinel-1 data results in a dataset with an area accuracy of 86.49% and an Intersection over Union (IoU) of 0.72-0.99 in different regions.

Causal Consequence.Question: How might changes in large-scale atmospheric circulation influence the data collected on lake variations in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Changes in large-scale atmospheric circulation may drive variations in lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, with potential inflection points affecting lake changes, as observed with the El Niño phenomenon, which influenced the expansion of lakes.

Causal Consequence.Question: What could be the implications of focusing more on smaller lakes for future climate change research and data collection in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Focusing on smaller lakes could reveal their active role in the global ecosystem and provide important feedback on global climate change, potentially influencing regional climate and environmental conditions.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of mapping lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau using high accuracy methods?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective is to analyze variations in lake area on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau and understand their response to climate changes, as these lakes provide feedback on global climate change and influence the regional environment and climate.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedural steps involved in using Sentinel-1 SAR data and the D-LinkNet framework to extract lake distributions over the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedural steps involve using Google Earth Engine (GEE) with the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) preparation framework to preprocess Sentinel-1 data covering the plateau. The D-LinkNet framework is then introduced to achieve lake extraction, resulting in a lake dataset from 2016 to 2021.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: How can one address the technological limitations and challenges in monitoring smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau using remote sensing techniques?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Addressing the technological limitations involves using advanced remote sensing techniques such as the D-LinkNet framework, which can enhance the accuracy of lake extraction despite challenges. Additionally, the use of platforms like Google Earth Engine (GEE) helps in handling large-scale data processing required for such a task.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What methodological approaches are applied to ensure high accuracy in mapping variations in lake areas on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The methodological approach includes using Sentinel-1 dataset with high accuracy mapping techniques such as the D-LinkNet framework, which ensures an area accuracy of 86.49% and Intersection over Union (IoU) ranging from 0.72 to 0.99 in different regions. This approach helps in analyzing variations in lake areas effectively.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements have enabled the extraction of lake data from Sentinel-1 SAR imagery on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Enablement.Answer: The use of the D-LinkNet framework combined with Google Earth Engine (GEE) and the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) preparation framework enabled high-accuracy lake extraction from Sentinel-1 SAR data.

Enablement.Question: How do data preprocessing techniques in the Google Earth Engine environment facilitate the mapping of lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Enablement.Answer: Google Earth Engine provides an environment for preprocessing Sentinel-1 data using the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) framework, which facilitates accurate mapping of lakes by preparing the data for efficient extraction processes.

Enablement.Question: What are the methodological challenges in capturing changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, and how are these addressed?
Enablement.Answer: The primary challenge arises from technological and methodological limitations in capturing smaller lake changes, which are addressed by utilizing advanced frameworks like D-LinkNet for precise extraction from satellite data.

Expectation.Question: Why might there be challenges in accurately mapping smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau using current technologies?
Expectation.Answer: Owing to the limitations of technology and methods, changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau have received less attention.

Expectation.Question: What are the anticipated reasons for using the Sentinel-1 dataset in mapping lake variations across the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Expectation.Answer: The research objective was to map lakes on the entire Qinghai-Tibet Plateau with high accuracy and to analyze variations in lake area based on the Sentinel-1 dataset.

Expectation.Question: Why might small lakes show higher activity levels compared to larger lakes or terrestrial ecosystems in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Expectation.Answer: Emerging research has shown that small lakes are more active than large lakes and terrestrial and marine ecosystems in almost every process, which is significant given the number of small lakes distributed on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.

Judgmental.Question: What is your evaluation of using Sentinel-1 SAR data in mapping small lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Judgmental.Answer: The use of Sentinel-1 SAR data is suitable for mapping small lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau as it allows for high accuracy in detecting changes in lake areas. The dataset created from this data shows an area accuracy of 86.49%, indicating its effectiveness in capturing lake dynamics in this region.

Judgmental.Question: How would you assess the challenges faced in detecting smaller lake changes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Judgmental.Answer: The challenges in detecting smaller lake changes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau are primarily due to technological and methodological limitations. Smaller lakes have received less attention historically, which may result in gaps in understanding their dynamics and sensitivity to climate change. However, using frameworks like D-LinkNet can mitigate some of these challenges by improving detection accuracy.

Assertion.Question: I'm not sure how data collection methods can effectively differentiate between small and large lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.
Assertion.Answer: The study used Sentinel-1 SAR data processed through Google Earth Engine (GEE) with the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) preparation framework, and employed the D-LinkNet framework for lake extraction, achieving a high accuracy of 86.49% in mapping lakes larger than 0.01 km².

Assertion.Question: I don't understand what challenges might arise in monitoring smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.
Assertion.Answer: One challenge in monitoring smaller lakes is related to the limitations of current technology and methods, which have historically received less attention compared to larger lakes. The study aims to address this by using advanced data processing techniques.

Assertion.Question: I can't make sense of how variations in lake data across different regions of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau are assessed accurately.
Assertion.Answer: The lake dataset from 2016 to 2021 showed an area accuracy of 86.49% and Intersection over Union (IoU) values ranging from 0.72-0.99 in different regions, suggesting that regional variations are assessed with a high level of precision using the chosen methodologies.

Request/Directive.Question: Please provide a summary of the methods used for lake mapping and data collection in high-altitude regions, particularly focusing on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.
Request/Directive.Answer: The data collection methods for lake mapping on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau utilized Google Earth Engine (GEE) with the Analysis Ready Data (ARD) preparation framework to obtain preprocessed Sentinel-1 data. The D-LinkNet framework was introduced to achieve lake extraction, enabling the creation of a dataset from 2016 to 2021.

Request/Directive.Question: Please analyze the challenges associated with detecting changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau and suggest potential improvements in methodology.
Request/Directive.Answer: Detecting changes in smaller lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau is challenging due to technological and methodological limitations. The study highlighted this issue and used advanced data processing frameworks like Google Earth Engine and D-LinkNet to improve detection. Further improvements could involve enhancing these technologies or incorporating additional remote sensing data sources to increase detection accuracy and resolution.
